leave in 2011. When Barack Obama was a candidate "and during the transition period, various conversations were held within the staff, but nothing was of interest to me," Colin Powell said. I would rather be someone the president calls on from time to time for personal advice, without me expecting anything in return or asking for a position, Colin Powell said. On Afghanistan, Colin Powell said the 30,000 additional U.S. troops Barack Obama authorized in December 2009 haven't turned the war decisively yet. The last of the additional troops arrived in October.

During the interview, Mr. Howard Stern commented that he doesn't like Jay Leno of NBC's Tonight Show and doesn't understand why his ratings are higher than David Letterman 's. America must be filled with morons, he said about Jay Leno 's fans who tune in every night. "I don't like Jay Leno personally," Howard Stern said. Mike Pence decision "major coup" for RGA- David Catanese: Mike Pence decision "major coup" for RGA Indiana Rep. Mike Pence isn't running for president, which means a gubernatorial run is almost inevitable. Mike Pence won't formally announce his gubernatorial campaign on Thursday-a state law prohibits announced candidates from raising money during the state legislative session, scheduled to end April-but he fully intends to run for governor, a source with knowledge of his thinking told POLITICO. Mike Pence was Perry's first recruitment call after he became chairman, a source with knowledge of the call told POLITICO, and Mike Pence met in Washington on Wednesday with Virginia Gov.
